lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: Safely stowed. ROSENCRANTZ: GUILDENSTERN: [Within]  Hamlet! Lord Hamlet! What noise? who calls on Hamlet? O, here they come.

lines.speaker: rosencrantz
lines.text: What have you done, my lord, with the dead body?

lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: Compounded it with dust, whereto 'tis kin.

lines.speaker: rosencrantz
lines.text: Tell us where 'tis, that we may take it thence And bear it to the chapel.

lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: That I can keep your counsel and not mine own. Besides, to be demanded of a sponge! what replication should be made by the son of a king?

lines.speaker: rosencrantz
lines.text: Take you me for a sponge, my lord?

lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: Ay, sir, that soaks up the king's countenance, his rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the king best service in the end: he keeps them, like an ape, in the corner of his jaw; first mouthed, to be last swallowed: when he needs what you have gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you shall be dry again.

lines.speaker: rosencrantz
lines.text: I understand you not, my lord.

lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: I am glad of it: a knavish speech sleeps in a foolish ear.

lines.speaker: rosencrantz
lines.text: My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go with us to the king.

lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: The body is with the king, but the king is not with the body. The king is a thing--

lines.speaker: hamlet
lines.text: Of nothing: bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after.
